style.name: Kellerbier (Cellar beer) or Zwickelbier - Ale
style.description: These beers are unfiltered German-style Altbier and Kölsch. They are packaged and/or served intentionally with low to moderate amounts of yeast. Products may be filtered and again dosed with yeast in the package, manifesting themselves as bottle conditioned beers or unfiltered beer with yeast present. They will most likely not be clear, and may appear slightly hazy to moderately cloudy. Yeast character, flavor and aroma are desirable, yet should be low to medium but not overpowering the balance and character of malt and hops. Low to moderately low levels of yeast-generated sulfur containing compounds should be apparent in aroma and flavor, and low levels of acetaldehyde or other volatiles normally removed during fermentation may or may not be apparent. The sulfur and acetaldehyde characters should contribute positively to the beer drinking experience. Head retention may not be optimal. The brewer must indicate the classic style on which the entry is based to allow for accurate judging. Beer entries not accompanied by this information will be at a disadvantage during evaluation.

breweries.name: Hacker-Pschorr
breweries.description:
The name Hacker-Pschorr stands for a Munich brew tradition crafted over centuries, and acclaimed far beyond the borders of Bavaria throughout the entire world. As a brewer focused on quality, Hacker-Pschorr of course brews in accordance with the Bavarian Reinheitsgebot or Beer Purity Law.
Our beer is sold in the popular traditional swing-top bottles.

style.name: Kellerbier (Cellar beer) or Zwickelbier - Ale

breweries.name: Schlossbrauerei Au-Hallertau
breweries.description:
The Schlossbrauerei Au-Halltertau respects the tradition and heritage of quality traditional premium brewing. For more than 400 years the brewery has been taking care that the local traditional beers are supplied regionally as well as internationally.

It is no longer important how advanced we are and how much technical support we use during our daily processes. The most important aspect for us is that we keep our traditional heritage. As we know the saying "New is not in comparison with the word better".

The Schlossbrauerei Au-Halltertau respects the tradition and heritage of quality traditional premium brewing. For more than 400 years the brewery has been taking care that the local traditional beers are supplied regionally as well as internationally. The first documented brew master was the royal court brew master named "Schweiger" in 1590. At that time the Noble Freiherr Baron von Thurn was the lord of the castle. He was the fourth noble lord since 990 a.d through 1281 a.d that ruled in Au Hallertau.

Since 1846 the Noble rulers and Baron Freiherren Beck von Peccoz have ruled and resided in the magnificent "Moated Castle" in Au i.d. Hallertau.

The noble family of Baron Freiherren Beck von Peccoz is still living in the castle an in the meantime it is the 6th generation.

At present Baron Freiherr Beck von Peccoz is making sure that the Castle Brewery stays a traditional brewery together with the necessary vision into the future to create a sustainable traditional premium quality future.

Michael Baron Freiherr Beck von Peccoz’s utmost desire is not to miss a successful sustainable future and at the same time to keep up the 6 generations of writing a successful historical event for the Castle brewery and it history.

The Brew Master Mr. Stefan Ebensperger is supporting the Baron with his highly qualified experience and skills. The necessary emotions and bindings towards a brewing heritage that has been passed down for generations is needed. Tradition is naturally one of the highest priorities for Mr. Ebensperger due to our traditional purity laws dating back to 1516 a.d therefore you can be assured that the quality is a premium German and he says, "It will also stay like that". Since 1516 the Bavarians have known how important the quality of the ingredients and the brewing process actually are. Beer was known during the Middle Ages as the same significant value as bread. As a part of the staple die, it was also germ free and full of healthy calories. During that time the average citizen spent a good 20 percent of their income on beer.

On the 23. April 1516 the Bavaria Duke Wilhelm IV. Executed and introduced the famous Bavarian Purity law into the Bavarian Parliament in Ingolstadt with the famous words: "Just like beer in Summer an in winter as well as the county or province it is brewed or served" Since that day it is prohibited to brew beer for the German market with anything else apart from hops, malt, water and yeast. In 1918 the Weimarer Republik accepted the Bavarian purity law into its republic, therefore the Bavarian purity then became a German law. Under the purity law or Bavaria and Germany the Castle Brewery, inspects, insures and stores all its quality premium beers as in the past historical way the Castle Lords and Brew Masters did.

breweries.name: Brauerei Hofstetten
breweries.description:
Half an hour's walk north of St. Martin in the heart of Mühlviertel, one sees them on a hill
- The brewery Hofstetten

Hofstetten is a private brewery and is in the possession of the family Krammer - since 1849th

For the production of beers Hofstettner raw materials are used only Austrian.

The brewery offers private wells from which water is taken for beer production. This is bedrock water that is filtered through the granite rock, and so only a very low hardness 3-6 ° dH - so the best way to brew beer for good.

The special malts, which are important for the quality of the beers come from the Austrian malt Plohberger (Grieskirchen) and the Stadlauer maltings.

For the pleasant bitterness in the beer aroma and bitter hops makes Mühlviertler that is planted with care by the hop growers from the region and harvested.

There currently are 11 staff employed, they make it possible year 5700 hl best beer brewing and that customer to supply innumerable. Furthermore, as each year about 4,000 visitors a topic of brewing beer and care, as part of a field trip brought closer.

Our goal is to bring our dishes closer to the true beer connoisseur.

data.name: Original Hochzeitsbier von 1810
data.description: Unfiltered, unpasteurized, darker, and stronger lager brewed to historic Oktoberfest specs. 100% Munich malt. 14.3°

breweries.name: Saarfürst Merziger Brauhaus am Yachthafen GmbH
breweries.nameShortDisplay: Saarfürst Merziger Brauhaus am Yachthafen GmbH

data.name: Saaz Monster Ale
data.description: This is a Zwickel beer packed full of Czech Saaz hops.  We decided to not filter this beer so as to not jeopardize the wonderful hop flavor and aroma. If you carefully swirl the glass and take a big whiff, you will get a full but delicate fresh hop aroma from only the best noble hop - Czech Saaz. We used nearly 2 lbs. of hops per barrel of beer which is not far off from what we use in our IPA, though this beer has half the bitterness. The flavor profile is spicy hops up front with a clean malt finish and pleasing bitterness.

breweries.name: The Church Brew Works
breweries.description: Nestled in historic Lawrenceville, this turn of the century cathedral church turned Brewpub offers a heavenly atmosphere! Enjoy our award winning handcrafted brews and American "Eclectic" cuisine.

data.name: Schloss Trunk
data.description: Well into the late nineteenth century the Bavarians traditionally brewed darker ale. Handed down from generation to generation, the ancient recipe for this bottom-fermented beer is now experiencing a grand comeback. Instantly recognizable by its amber tone combined with a quaint "olde worlde" malty aroma and harmonious full-bodied taste, this unfiltered Maxlrain speciality in the good old swing-top closure bottle is enough to make the heart of any beer aesthete beat faster.

breweries.name: Schlossbrauerei Maxlrain
breweries.description: Schlossbrauerei Maxlrain is first mentioned in 1636. It was a “brown beer” brewery as was customary in those times. While a great deal has changed in the meantime, essential features have survived. Thus, Maxlrain is and remains a local private brewery under independent management. The fifteen styles of beer classified under pale ale, dark ale, Pils or wheat beer are all brewed applying manual skills utilizing finest ingredients enhanced by our own source of spring water drawn from the Mangfall Valley.

data.name: Trail Bender Wheat
data.description:
Trail Bender wheat, blends the flavors of an American Wheat Beer with a German Kolsch ale.  The result, a light and refreshing beer, reminiscent of your favorite German lager.

Enjoy this crisp and refreshing unfiltered wheat beer on a warm afternoon or after a hike on your favorite trail.  Beer aficionados will enjoy the balanced noble hop character and Trail Bender’s malty wheat backbone.
data.foodPairings: Salads, Scallops, Fish, Chicken, Turkey, Bratwurst, Dill Havarti, Goat Cheese, White Cheddar, Cheesecake

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Kellerbier (Cellar beer) or Zwickelbier - Ale
style.description: These beers are unfiltered German-style Altbier and Kölsch. They are packaged and/or served intentionally with low to moderate amounts of yeast. Products may be filtered and again dosed with yeast in the package, manifesting themselves as bottle conditioned beers or unfiltered beer with yeast present. They will most likely not be clear, and may appear slightly hazy to moderately cloudy. Yeast character, flavor and aroma are desirable, yet should be low to medium but not overpowering the balance and character of malt and hops. Low to moderately low levels of yeast-generated sulfur containing compounds should be apparent in aroma and flavor, and low levels of acetaldehyde or other volatiles normally removed during fermentation may or may not be apparent. The sulfur and acetaldehyde characters should contribute positively to the beer drinking experience. Head retention may not be optimal. The brewer must indicate the classic style on which the entry is based to allow for accurate judging. Beer entries not accompanied by this information will be at a disadvantage during evaluation.

breweries.name: Bur Oak Brewing Company
breweries.description: Brewed for those that share a connection with the people who originally embraced craft beers, Bur Oak Brewing Company delivers meticulously executed yet approachable, stylistic craft beers intended to bring communities together.

data.name: Ungespundetes Landbier
data.description: Our beer is an unfiltered beer with low fermentation cellar 12.5% ​​original wort, and a content of about 4.7% vol.alc. Balanced and spicy in taste, easy to drink. It Consists of 80% light and 20% dark paints.

breweries.name: Bier Brewery & Taproom
breweries.description: The Bier Brewery and Taproom is excited to be one of the newest breweries in Indiana.  We are committed to the highest quality and best tasting bier in Indianapolis.  Our small size allows BIER to have the utmost control over the many different variables that go into brewing a batch of beer.

Sunday: 12:00 PM - 4:00 PM

data.name: ZwickelKolsch
data.description: We take our normal Kolsch, brew it light, condition it long and leave the German yeast in it.  With the hot summer of Eastern Washington in full swing, this is a great summertime relaxation brew.  If this style is new to you, give it a try and see what you think!

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

breweries.name: White Bluffs Brewing
breweries.description:
Opening November 2010 in Richland, WA, White Bluffs Brewing has been creating great brews since day one. 
We started as a 2 bbl brewery, grew to a 7 bbl brewery and are now expanding to a 15 bbl brewery....and we are excited!
Our love of beer, quality ingredients, and 25+ years of experience gives us more than one reason to serve Richland, Kennewick, Pasco and the Northwest with great beer.

Stop in and say hi, we'd love to give you a tour and hang out while you enjoy our humble brewery!

We say "we brew beer with character for people with taste,"  Check us out and find out why.

Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm
Sat: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

data.name: Zwiefalter Abt
data.description: An unfiltered beer of excellent quality, which is brewed according to old, traditional recipe.
